messages.title: Saving Our Schools
messages.content: Tory and Lib Dem austerity has caused our schools spending to be slashed and services reduced. We have seen this in larger class sizes, fewer teachers, ancient IT equipment and school staff; begging letters for funds for basic equipment and books. Some schools can't even afford to open on Fridays... In Rushcliffe, 33 schools have suffered cuts, with a total shortfall of £3.8M. The cuts to our schools are deeply unfair. We should never stop fighting for our children's future. We will campaign for fairer funding for our children and grandchildren until every school is properly resourced to give each child the education they deserve. Labour will make sure schools are properly resourced with increased funding formulas that leaves no child worse off. We will invest in upgrade classrooms, hire more teachers, and give teachers a pay rise.

messages.title: Saving Our NHS
messages.content: A decade of Tory health cuts and privatisation has pushed our nation's greatest institution to the brink. Staff are under record stress, NHS waiting times and patient complaints are at record levels, and many hospital buildings are inadequate and crumbling. There are 100,000 staff vacancies in NHS England, including 43,000 nurse vacancies, and over 15,000 doctor vacancies. Tory cuts have reduced the number of health visitors by over 2,000 since 2015. Conservative privatisation is also making the NHS raise a black alert with over 4.4 million people now on hospital waiting lists. Labour will end NHS privatisation. Our mission is to eradicate injustice, to transform and save lives through morning sickness to longer life and a healthier life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Scrap university tuition fees, reinstate Education Maintenance Allowance, introduce free primary school meals, reverse school cuts, invest in apprenticeships.

Restore nursing training bursaries, train 24,000 nurses & midwives, end privatisation, fair pay for all NHS staff, free prescriptions, free dental check-ups, fully fund mental health support, train 5,000 new GPs.
Build 100,000 council homes per year, build 1 million affordable homes over 5 years, proper insulation, protect private renters, end rough sleeping.
Ban fracking, make the UK carbon neutral by 2030, create 1 million sustainable jobs, launch the Green Industrial Revolution, create new parks & urban green spaces.
Free TV licenses for over 75s, protect winter fuel allowance, free social care for over 65s, increase carers allowance, compensate WASPI women, scrap Universal Credit & sanctions.
Support a second referendum with remain on the ballot and campaign to remain as I did in 2016.
